comment: This is my 2nd time taking Prof. Murphy, he's an overall a funny and understanding guy. This class was very lab heavy, so it was somewhat difficult to balance weeks with longer labs, but he often extended deadlines and is very quick to respond to emails! We had a group game project, make sure to pick your own group or it will be assigned for you

It feels like he forgot about his online class. One assignment followed a 10-year-old outdated tutorial, so most of your time was wasted. Sometimes lectures/notes weren't even uploaded. On the last day I withdrew because, even after reaching out, not a single manual grade was in. Lots of complaints but the content itself was usually straightforward

I absolutely love this professor. I worked with him a lot in and out of class and he was helpful every step of the way in all his classes I took. The only problem that I found were that he only graded everything at the end of the semester. Other than this however, I can't imagine having a better professor for CGDD classes.

Dr. Murphy was always very engaging in class while doing his best to answer any questions. He is knowledgeable in the field and cares about his students. The only reason this is not a 5 is that many homework assignments took a while to get graded and it was pretty hard to know how I was doing in the class due to that. 
TLDR:
Good prof, slow grader.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Murphy is a genuinely engaging and interesting professor that is knowledgeable and passionate about the subject matter. Your grade is mostly from semi-weekly quizzes, two tests (midterm + final), assignments, and a couple group projects. There is no busy work in this class, all assignments are meaningful and usually fun to complete!

Decent. Provides good study guides/notes for the tests. Helpful with advice on the stuff we're learning, too, however he takes a while to reply to emails, which can be kinda frustrating. Overall, he's a pretty good teacher. :)
He's very chill and his lectures are easy and he keeps it simple. I only had to do quizzes after each module and 3 tests including final. would take him again
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Murphy is a very dedicated and knowledgeable instructor who has real world experience in the field. Positively, this means he will try to help you gain as much experience and understanding as possible, negatively this means he can be difficult at times with his expectations and hopes for you. Overall, a very attentive and great professor

He's really nice and replies to emails in a decent amount of time. He is always willing to help and clarify instructions, he wasn't the one to teach the lab but he was always on top of it if you reach out. Very nice professor would take again
he is a great caring professor who gives great feedback and has very interesting stories that relate to the topics we are discussing in class.I would take this class again.

The class was very easy. There are two exams and a final in the class (online using lockdown browser). While the lectures are not mandatory, they are very useful and Professor Murphy makes sure every student is prepared for the exams. Hopefully this will not be the last time I take a class with him.

If you do not know how to code, do not join this course. Out of everyone there I felt like the odd one out because of how difficult the class was. My friend learned loops midway while we were already learning all the basics the first month. I do not recommend taking it if you are new to comp sci or software engineering.

I hope this won't be my last class with him! He re-records his lectures each semester. He gives really good, detailed, actionable, and helpful feedback on assignments. He quickly responds to questions posed on D2L. He has many, many interesting and applicable anecdotes and experiences from his time working in the industry. He's also really friendly

He graded exams far too harshly. I was sitting at a B pretty much all semester. The final was far too much work for the time allotted ended up failing the class. All other tests seemed to be worded specifically with the intention to trip you up and not test your knowledge. I would not take him again unless you are a good test taker.

This is not about the teacher but when taking the lab you deal with GTA STUDENTS so beware that they are different from one another I had terrible GTAS but I heard others had very good ones. The lab is mainly self-taught so try to find sources to help you through it. Labs and assignments are easy to go through but exams can be very hard so GL.

Really solid choice. Super helpful if you email or ask questions. 3 tests with lockdown browser and quizzes every week that are open note. Tests are a little tricky but not horrible. Won't be disappointed if you take him.

He's a wonderful professor, responds very quick to emails and is happy to help however he can. Three tests, all on lockdown browser with camera but were fairly easy. The quizzes were also pretty easy and didn't have a lockdown browser. All in all fairly easy class and a great professor, would definitely take him again.

Knowledgeable, cares about students, and communicates throughout the week. You can easily reach him with any questions.
9 quizzes = 25% - easy 100 on every quiz so far, not lockdown.
Tests (3) are 25% each, final replaces lowest test grade - all lockdown. Study guides are great.
Chapter readings each week, but I never did them & currently have an A
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment:
Absolutely amazing! This is my first time rating a professor in the few years that I have been a student, and he is VERY helpful. I definitely recommend him!!!!

-Amal H.

This was an okay class. Grade was based solely off quizzes and tests. Tests were difficult but passable. He provided a lot of material to go over, and no textbook was required. Watch all lectures and study heavily to ensure good grade. Tests were on lockdown browsers.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Wonderful experience with Nick Murphy for my Honors 1321 course this semester. He gives wonderful feedback and is willing to answer any questions or find the answers for you if he does not know off the top of his head. Murphy knows what he is talking about and clearly shows it when presenting information to students during lecture. Would recommend!

Probably the best teacher I've had my entire life, give this man a raise. Had him for CSE1321 and he made coding incredibly easy to learn. I went in knowing absolutely nothing about coding and came out a master. The beginning of the class may be confusing at first but you'll get the hang of it.

His teaching style are funny, he will try his best to explain you the problems in multiple computer languages. He is caring for every single students in classroom, passionate about the lecture. He's even help you to fix your coding lab session also.

Mr. Murphy is an amazing professor. He is very knowledgeable about the topic. He is very funny during classes. I appreciate that he stops to make sure everyone is following him. An amazing option to take. One of the best professors I have ever had.

Mr. Murphy seems like a guy who would be a good host/leader for an escape room. He's got a witty and interesting personality and at the same time, he knows what he's doing, for the most part. Overall, a great fit for teaching the Honors class.
This class was extremely easy with clear lectures to follow but few graded assignments. There are a few quizzes and 2 tests so its important to do well on the tests
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I am not great at programming, barely passed CSE1322 but was able to take this class and understand things so much better. He is easy to reach outside of class and he is very helpful without just telling you how to do it. I understood programming much better after taking this class too! Take him if you have the opportunity, he's great.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: AMAZING! Great professor and very caring. He is super helpful and the project and discussions are a lot of fun. Quizzes are a little hard but passable with the textbook nearby, same with exams, no lockdown browser either. Would take again, no question!

Professor Murphy was great and really helped me enjoy this class. He goes out of his way to make sure that he interacts with students who may be online or in person. He is passionate about the subject material and makes it easy for people to understand. This class takes plenty of effort with projects, homework, discussions, quizzes, midterm/final

I took him for lab and he was very helpful. He would always respond back when emailed and he always gave good feedback on my incomplete labs. He also is always willing to help and he gave our class a few extensions when we were all having trouble. If you are meh with code like I am, you should be fine because of how helpful professor Murphy is.

Professor Murphy was great for the lecture class. He clearly explained what we needed to do for every project and he was always willing to help. He was teaching a lot of classes so sometimes the emails may get lost but he always says to email him again if he hasn't answered. I didn't attend class in person, instead showed up on Ultra and I was fine

Nick was awesome! So professional and caring and he also gives really good feedback on every assignment. He's fast with grading and it's a super easy class to pass. Make sure you do your discussions and assignments on time. But they are very hw assignments.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Please do not take this him. He doesn't grade on time. His class is extremely difficult and he makes it worse. If you email him about your grade asking how you could fix it, he would not respond. His tests are extremely difficult. This class is not an easy A or easy to pass.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: I took him for Software Testing and the material itself is not easy so the class was challenging but he made it bearable! Hes also very receptive to feedback! His personality and humor are great! He responds to email and even ran up the stairs in the Atrium to talk to me one time!! Ha! He just needs to work on not taking months to grade stuff!!

Prof. Murphy is knowledgeable, funny, and wants you to do well. Only issues I had was he takes a long time to grade assignments and get them back to you. the class is based around 5 HWs , group project, & midterm/final . If you actively participate you should be fine on all the assignments. Tip: CHOOSE A GROUP THAT WILL ACTUALLY CONTRIBUTE

He is a very likable person and funny. However, he takes ages to grade assignments and you will likely have a project deadline before you get feedback on the relevant homework assigned before hand. Instructions on all assignments are vague and the entire class had to ask for clarification multiple times.

If youre looking for an easy A, this isnt the Professor you want to take. He only has 2 tests (30%), about 10 online quizzes (10%), group project (30%) & the final (30%). All his test are written, no multiple choice. Hes not a bad person, hes just not the best instructor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: I have taken Murphy, Nicholas twice now and look forward to it every time I see him instructing a class. He's my favorite teacher I've had and has a great sense of humor! He is always willing to help with questions He is caring and is amazing when it comes to lectures Hw is always related to the subject and I never feel lost in his class.

I happened to have two of Mr. Murphy's classes during summer semester. BEING the first time he taught college lectures he was AMAZING. Very clear, always helpful and allows you to really absorb the information. He brings up real-world examples of when and if he used these topics in class. Put forth some effort and you'll be fine, TAKE HIM!
